Description: Black steatite cylinder seal: perforated through the centre, bearing incised designs of Mesopotamian character. These include four figures of fish, four hollow ovals and a circle with four radiating lines, surrounded by cross-hatching. Good condition, although slightly chipped.
Excavator/field collector: Field Collection by: Rev George Denis Nash
Curator's comments: Compare A. Scharff, ‘Die Altertümer der Vor – und Frühzeit Ägyptens II (Berlin, 1929-31), nos.133, 135-6 and pl.25; H. J. Kantor, 'Journal of Near Eastern Studies' 11 (1952) 239-50; A. M. Lythgoe and D. Dunham, 'The predynastic cemetery, N 7000 : Naga-ed-Dêr' IV (Berkeley, 1965), 180, fig. 79h. Bibliography: A. F. Shore, 'British Museum Quarterly' 24 (1961), 35 and pl. xd.
